name: Vorpal Sword
flavour: The blade hums with an eager, almost hungry resonance. Its edge exists in a state of impossible sharpness—legends say it was folded in the space between moments, tempered in the silence before thunder.
description:
You gain a +3 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic weapon. In addition, the weapon ignores resistance to slashing damage.

**Vorpal Strike**
When you attack a creature that has at least one head with this weapon and roll a 20 on the attack roll, you cut off one of the creature's heads. The creature dies if it can't survive without the lost head. A creature is immune to this effect if it is immune to slashing damage, doesn't have or need a head, has legendary actions, or the DM decides that the creature is too big for its head to be cut off with this weapon.

**Severing Edge**
Critical hits with this weapon deal an additional 6d8 slashing damage.

name: Holy Avenger
flavour: The blade radiates a warmth that speaks of dawn breaking over ancient battlefields. Its crossguard bears the wings of celestial messengers, and when drawn in righteous cause, it blazes with holy fire.
description:
You gain a +3 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic weapon. When you hit a fiend or an undead with it, that creature takes an extra 2d10 radiant damage.

**Aura of Protection**
While you hold the drawn sword, it creates an aura in a 10-foot radius around you. You and all creatures friendly to you in the aura have advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

**Divine Conduit**
If you have 17 or more levels in the paladin class, the radius of the aura increases to 30 feet.

name: Staff of Power
properties: Versatile (1d8), requires attunement by a sorcerer, warlock, or wizard
flavour: Crystalline veins pulse with arcane energy along the staff's length, converging at a headpiece that seems to drink in ambient light. The wood itself is warm to the touch, thrumming with barely contained power.
description:
This staff can be wielded as a magic quarterstaff that grants a +2 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with it. While holding it, you gain a +2 bonus to Armor Class, saving throws, and spell attack rolls.

**Power Strike**
When you hit with a melee attack using the staff, you can expend 1 charge to deal an extra 1d6 force damage to the target.

**Spells**
The staff has 20 charges. While holding it, you can use an action to expend 1 or more charges to cast one of the following spells: cone of cold (5 charges), fireball (5th-level, 5 charges), globe of invulnerability (6 charges), hold monster (5 charges), levitate (2 charges), lightning bolt (5th-level, 5 charges), magic missile (1 charge), ray of enfeeblement (1 charge), or wall of force (5 charges).

**Retributive Strike**
You can break the staff as an action, releasing its magic in an explosion.

name: Cloak of Invisibility
flavour: The fabric seems woven from twilight itself—neither fully present nor absent. When still, it might be mistaken for a shadow; when moving, it bends light around itself like water around a stone.
description:
While wearing this cloak, you can pull its hood over your head to cause yourself to become invisible. While you are invisible, anything you are carrying or wearing is invisible with you. You become visible when you cease wearing the hood. Pulling the hood up or down requires an action.

**Deduct Time**
The cloak can be used for a total of 2 hours, all at once or in increments of 1 minute. After 2 hours of use, the cloak ceases to function. For every uninterrupted period of 12 hours the cloak goes unused, it regains 1 hour of duration.

name: Flame Tongue Longsword
flavour: The steel carries an inner fire that never quite dies—even sheathed, the blade is warm to the touch. When the command word is spoken, flames race along its edge like eager hounds released from a leash.
description:
You can use a bonus action to speak this magic sword's command word, causing flames to erupt from the blade. These flames shed bright light in a 40-foot radius and dim light for an additional 40 feet. While the sword is ablaze, it deals an extra 2d6 fire damage to any target it hits. The flames last until you use a bonus action to speak the command word again or until you drop or sheathe the sword.

**Illumination**
The flames provide both tactical advantage and practical light source, revealing hidden enemies and dark passages alike.

name: Amulet of Health
flavour: A deep red gem pulses with a rhythm that matches—then steadies—your heartbeat. Ancient healers called these 'vitality stones,' claiming they anchor the soul more firmly to the body.
description:
Your Constitution score is 19 while you wear this amulet. It has no effect on you if your Constitution is already 19 or higher without it.

**Fortified Vitality**
The amulet's magic reinforces your physical resilience, granting the Constitution of a trained warrior regardless of your natural constitution.

name: Ioun Stone (Protection)
flavour: This dusty rose prism orbits your head in slow, deliberate circuits. It seems almost aware—dodging grasping hands and weaving between sword strokes as if it shares your survival instinct.
description:
An Ioun stone is named after Ioun, a god of knowledge and prophecy. When you use an action to toss one of these stones into the air, the stone orbits your head at a distance of 1d3 feet and confers a benefit to you.

**Protection**
You gain a +1 bonus to AC while this dusty rose prism orbits your head.

**Vulnerability**
Another creature can use an action to grasp or net the stone to separate it from you, either by making a successful attack roll against AC 24 or a successful DC 24 Dexterity (Acrobatics) check.

name: Ring of Protection
flavour: Delicate silver bands interweave in an endless knot, the pattern shifting subtly when danger approaches. Those who wear it speak of a constant, gentle pressure—like an unseen hand ready to deflect.
description:
You gain a +1 bonus to AC and saving throws while wearing this ring.

**Warding Magic**
The ring's protective enchantment extends beyond mere physical defence, bolstering your resistance to magical effects and environmental hazards alike.

name: Dagger of Venom
flavour: The blade weeps a single black tear that never quite falls. Serpentine patterns etched into the steel seem to writhe in torchlight, and the handle is wrapped in snakeskin that's cool to the touch.
description:
You gain a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic weapon.

**Poison**
You can use an action to cause thick, black poison to coat the blade. The poison remains for 1 minute or until an attack using this weapon hits a creature. That creature must succeed on a DC 15 Constitution saving throw or take 2d10 poison damage and become poisoned for 1 minute. The dagger can't be used this way again until the next dawn.

name: Potion of Invisibility
flavour: The liquid inside this vial is perfectly clear—so clear that the vial appears empty until tilted. It tastes of nothing and leaves no sensation, as if you'd swallowed pure absence.
description: This potion's container looks empty but feels as though it holds liquid. When you drink it, you become invisible for 1 hour. Anything you wear or carry is invisible with you. The effect ends early if you attack or cast a spell.

name: Wand of Magic Missiles
description:
This wand has 7 charges. While holding it, you can use an action to expend 1 or more of its charges to cast the magic missile spell from it. For 1 charge, you cast the 1st-level version of the spell. You can increase the spell slot level by one for each additional charge you expend.

The wand regains 1d6 + 1 expended charges daily at dawn. If you expend the wand's last charge, roll a d20. On a 1, the wand crumbles into ashes and is destroyed.

name: Helm of Telepathy
description:
While wearing this helm, you can use an action to cast the detect thoughts spell (save DC 13) from it. As long as you maintain concentration on the spell, you can use a bonus action to send a telepathic message to a creature you are focused on.

The creature can reply telepathically. While focusing on a creature with detect thoughts, you can use an action to cast the suggestion spell (save DC 13) from the helm on that creature. Once used, the suggestion property can't be used again until the next dawn.

name: Gauntlets of Ogre Power
description: Your Strength score is 19 while you wear these gauntlets. They have no effect on you if your Strength is already 19 or higher without them.

name: Cloak of Protection
description: You gain a +1 bonus to AC and saving throws while you wear this cloak.

name: Cloak of Elvenkind
description: While you wear this cloak with its hood up, Wisdom (Perception) checks made to see you have disadvantage, and you have advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks made to hide, as the cloak's color shifts to camouflage you. Pulling the hood up or down requires an action.

name: Bag of Holding
description:
This bag has an interior space considerably larger than its outside dimensions, roughly 2 feet in diameter at the mouth and 4 feet deep. The bag can hold up to 500 pounds, not exceeding a volume of 64 cubic feet. The bag weighs 15 pounds, regardless of its contents.

Retrieving an item from the bag requires an action. If the bag is overloaded, pierced, or torn, it ruptures and is destroyed, and its contents are scattered in the Astral Plane.

name: Greatsword +1
description: You have a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic weapon.

name: Decanter of Endless Water
description:
This stoppered flask sloshes when shaken, as if it contains water. The decanter weighs 2 pounds.

You can use an action to remove the stopper and speak one of three command words:
- **Stream**: 1 gallon of water per round
- **Fountain**: 5 gallons of water per round
- **Geyser**: 30 gallons of water per round (can push creatures)

name: Bracers of Archery
description: While wearing these bracers, you have proficiency with the longbow and shortbow, and you gain a +2 bonus to damage rolls on ranged attacks made with such weapons.

name: Longbow +1
description: You have a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic weapon.

name: Battleaxe +1
description: You have a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic weapon.

name: Studded Leather +1
description: You have a +1 bonus to AC while wearing this armor. Studded leather armor is made from tough but flexible leather, reinforced with close-set rivets or spikes.

name: Rapier +1
description: You have a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic weapon.

name: Boots of Elvenkind
description: While you wear these boots, your steps make no sound, regardless of the surface you are moving across. You also have advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks that rely on moving silently.

name: Lantern of Revealing
description: While lit, this hooded lantern burns for 6 hours on 1 pint of oil, shedding bright light in a 30-foot radius and dim light for an additional 30 feet. Invisible creatures and objects are visible as long as they are in the lantern's bright light. You can use an action to lower the hood, reducing the light to dim light in a 5-foot radius.

name: Goggles of Night
description: While wearing these dark lenses, you have darkvision out to a range of 60 feet. If you already have darkvision, wearing the goggles increases its range by 60 feet.

name: Chain Shirt +1
description: You have a +1 bonus to AC while wearing this armor. Made of interlocking metal rings, a chain shirt is worn between layers of clothing or leather.

name: Shortsword +1
description: You have a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic weapon.

name: Shield +1
description: While holding this shield, you have a +1 bonus to AC. This bonus is in addition to the shield's normal bonus to AC.

name: Rope of Climbing
description: This 60-foot length of silk rope weighs 3 pounds and can hold up to 3,000 pounds. If you hold one end of the rope and use an action to speak the command word, the rope animates. As a bonus action, you can command the other end to move toward a destination you choose. That end moves 10 feet on your turn when you first command it and 10 feet on each of your turns until reaching its destination, up to its maximum length away, or until you tell it to stop.

name: Potion of Greater Healing
description: You regain 4d4 + 4 hit points when you drink this potion. The potion's red liquid glimmers when agitated.

name: Potion of Healing
description: You regain 2d4 + 2 hit points when you drink this potion. The potion's red liquid glimmers when agitated.

name: Ball Bearings (Bag of 1000)
description: As an action, you can spill these tiny metal balls from their pouch to cover a level, square area that is 10 feet on a side. A creature moving across the covered area must succeed on a DC 10 Dexterity saving throw or fall prone. A creature moving through the area at half speed doesn't need to make the save.

name: Oathbow
flavour: Carved from the heartwood of a tree that witnessed an ancient betrayal, this bow remembers every broken promise. When you speak your oath against a foe, the wood creaks with anticipation—it hungers to see vows fulfilled.
description:
When you nock an arrow on this bow, it whispers in Elvish, 'Swift defeat to my enemies.' When you use this weapon to make a ranged attack, you can, as a command phrase, say, 'Swift death to you who have wronged me.' The target of your attack becomes your sworn enemy until it dies or until dawn seven days later.

**Sworn Enemy**
You have advantage on attack rolls against your sworn enemy, and your sworn enemy gains no benefit from cover (other than total cover). When you hit your sworn enemy with this weapon, it takes an extra 3d6 piercing damage.

**Single Focus**
While your sworn enemy lives, you have disadvantage on attack rolls with all other weapons.

name: Bow of Warning
flavour: The bowstring hums with a frequency just below hearing—a constant vigilance that seeps into your bones. Those who carry it sleep lighter, dream sharper, and are never truly caught unaware.
description:
You gain a +2 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic weapon.

**Warning**
While this weapon is on your person, you have advantage on initiative rolls. In addition, you and any of your companions within 30 feet of you can't be surprised, except when incapacitated by something other than nonmagical sleep. The weapon magically awakens you and your companions within range if any of you are sleeping naturally when combat begins.

**Sentinel's Instinct**
Once per long rest, when you would be hit by an attack you cannot see, you can use your reaction to impose disadvantage on that attack roll.

name: Greater Bracers of Archery
flavour: These leather bracers are tooled with images of hawks in flight, their eyes inlaid with tiny amber stones that catch the light. When you draw a bow, you feel the phantom grip of master archers guiding your aim.
description:
While wearing these bracers, you have proficiency with the longbow and shortbow, and you gain a +2 bonus to damage rolls on ranged attacks made with such weapons.

**Steady Aim**
Once per turn, when you miss with a ranged weapon attack using a bow, you can reroll the attack roll. You must use the new roll.

**Eagle's Eye**
You can see clearly up to 1 mile away, suffering no disadvantage on Perception checks due to distance.

name: Quiver of Ehlonna
flavour: Blessed by the goddess of forests, this quiver's interior holds far more than physics should allow. Reaching in, your fingers always find exactly what you need—as if the quiver itself anticipates the hunt.
description:
Each of the quiver's three compartments connects to an extradimensional space:

**Compartments**
• The shortest compartment can hold up to sixty arrows, bolts, or similar objects
• The midsize compartment holds up to eighteen javelins or similar objects
• The longest compartment holds up to six long objects, such as bows, quarterstaffs, or spears

You can draw any item the quiver contains as if doing so from a regular quiver or scabbard.

name: Arrow of Dragon Slaying
flavour: The arrowhead is forged from a dragon's own shed scale, turned against its kind. Faint draconic runes along the shaft pulse with barely contained fury—this arrow remembers what it once was, and seeks vengeance.
description:
An arrow of slaying is a magic weapon meant to slay a particular kind of creature. If a creature belonging to the type associated with an arrow of slaying takes damage from the arrow, the creature must make a DC 17 Constitution saving throw, taking an extra 6d10 piercing damage on a failed save, or half as much extra damage on a successful one.

**Dragon Slayer**
This arrow is designed to kill dragons. Once it deals its extra damage, it becomes a nonmagical arrow.

name: Arrows +2 (Bundle of 10)
flavour: Each arrow is perfectly balanced, fletched with griffin feathers that self-correct in flight. The steel heads hold an edge that seems sharper than the smith's tools should have allowed.
description:
You have a +2 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with these magic arrows. Once an arrow hits or misses its target, the magic fades and it becomes a mundane arrow.

**Bundle**
This bundle contains 10 arrows.

name: Cloak of the Forest Guardian
flavour: Woven from leaves that never wither and dyed with moss that still grows, this cloak shifts its pattern with the seasons. In winter, it's bark and snow; in summer, dappled green light.
description:
While wearing this cloak, you have advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks made to hide in natural terrain. The cloak's color shifts to camouflage you.

**Nature's Embrace**
You can move through nonmagical difficult terrain without expending extra movement. You can also pass through nonmagical plants without being slowed by them and without taking damage from them if they have thorns, spines, or similar hazards.

**Woodland Stride**
Once per long rest, you can cast Pass Without Trace without expending a spell slot.

name: Boots of the Tireless Tracker
flavour: The leather of these boots was cured in the footprints of a legendary huntsman who tracked his quarry across three continents. They carry echoes of that relentless pursuit.
description:
While wearing these boots, your walking speed increases by 10 feet.

**Tireless Pursuit**
You have advantage on Wisdom (Survival) checks made to track creatures. Additionally, you can travel at a fast pace without suffering the normal -5 penalty to passive Wisdom (Perception).

**Endurance**
You can march for up to 12 hours before requiring a Constitution saving throw to avoid exhaustion.

name: Vineshot Bow
flavour: Living vines twist around the bow's limbs, flowering briefly each time you draw. The arrows it looses trail seeds that root on impact—nature claiming what was taken.
description:
You gain a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic weapon.

**Entangling Shot**
Once per short rest, when you hit a creature with an arrow from this bow, you can cause grasping vines to erupt around the target. The target must succeed on a DC 14 Strength saving throw or be restrained until the end of your next turn.

**Nature's Quiver**
While holding this bow, you can use a bonus action to magically create one piece of ammunition. Arrows created this way vanish after 1 minute if not used.

name: Arrows +1 (Bundle of 20)
description:
You have a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with these magic arrows. Once an arrow hits or misses its target, the magic fades and it becomes a mundane arrow.

**Bundle**
This bundle contains 20 arrows.

name: Hunter's Snare Kit
description:
This leather satchel contains materials to create 5 magical snare traps. As an action, you can set a snare in an unoccupied 5-foot square within 5 feet of you.

**Trigger**
The first creature that steps into the space must succeed on a DC 13 Dexterity saving throw or be restrained for 1 minute. The creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns.

**Camouflage**
Snares are nearly invisible, requiring a DC 15 Perception check to spot.

name: Beast Caller's Whistle
description:
This carved bone whistle produces a sound only beasts can hear. You can use an action to blow the whistle and cast Animal Friendship (save DC 13) without expending a spell slot.

**Uses**
The whistle has 3 charges and regains all expended charges daily at dawn.

**Wild Empathy**
While the whistle is on your person, you have advantage on Wisdom (Animal Handling) checks.

name: Arrows (Quiver of 20)
description: A leather quiver containing 20 standard arrows with steel broadheads.

name: Trail Rations (10 days)
description: Dried meat, hardtack, and nuts. Enough to sustain one person for 10 days.

name: Torches (Bundle of 10)
description: Wooden torches wrapped in oil-soaked cloth. Each burns for 1 hour, providing bright light in a 20-foot radius.

name: Hempen Rope (50 feet)
description: Strong hemp rope, useful for climbing, binding, or rescue operations. Can support up to 500 pounds.

name: Caltrops (Bag of 20)
description: Four-pronged metal spikes. Scatter them to cover a 5-foot square. Creatures entering must succeed on DC 15 Dex save or stop and take 1 piercing damage.

name: Oil Flask (5 flasks)
description: Flammable oil in ceramic flasks. Can fuel a lantern for 6 hours or be thrown as an improvised weapon (5 fire damage over 2 rounds if ignited).

name: Thieves' Tools
description: A set of lockpicks, a small mirror, narrow-bladed scissors, and a pair of pliers. Required for picking locks and disabling traps.

name: Healer's Kit
description: Bandages, salves, and splints. Has 10 uses. Can stabilize a dying creature without needing a Wisdom (Medicine) check.

name: Climber's Kit
description: Pitons, boot tips, gloves, and a harness. When anchored, you can't fall more than 25 feet and can't fall to the bottom.

name: Grappling Hook
description: A four-pronged iron hook attached to a rope. Can be thrown to anchor to ledges, windows, or battlements.

name: Manacles
description: Iron restraints that bind a creature's wrists or ankles. Escaping requires DC 20 Dexterity check or DC 26 Strength check. Unlocking requires thieves' tools and DC 15 check.

name: Antitoxin (vial)
description: Drinking this grants advantage on saving throws against poison for 1 hour. Does not cure existing poisoned condition.

name: Sun Blade
flavour: The hilt alone remains until you grasp it—then a blade of pure sunlight springs forth, humming with radiant energy. Undead creatures recoil from its brilliance as shadows flee before dawn.
description:
This item appears to be a longsword hilt. While grasping the hilt, you can use a bonus action to cause a blade of pure radiance to spring into existence, or make the blade disappear.

**Radiant Blade**
While the blade exists, this magic longsword has the finesse property. You gain a +2 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this weapon, which deals radiant damage instead of slashing damage.

**Sunlight**
The sword's luminous blade emits bright light in a 15-foot radius and dim light for an additional 15 feet. The light is sunlight. You can extinguish or restore the light as a bonus action.

**Bane of Undead**
When you hit an undead with it, that target takes an extra 1d8 radiant damage.

name: Luck Blade
flavour: Fortune favours those who carry this blade. Its edge gleams with an otherworldly sheen, and those who wield it swear they can feel fate itself bending in their favour.
description:
You gain a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic weapon. While the sword is on your person, you also gain a +1 bonus to saving throws.

**Luck**
If the sword is on your person, you can call on its luck (no action required) to reroll one attack roll, ability check, or saving throw you dislike. You must use the second roll. This property can't be used again until the next dawn.

**Wish**
The sword has 1d4-1 charges. While holding it, you can use an action to expend 1 charge and cast the Wish spell from it. This property can't be used again until the next dawn.

name: Robe of the Archmagi
properties: Wondrous item (requires attunement by a sorcerer, warlock, or wizard)
flavour: Woven from threads of pure magic, this robe shimmers with arcane symbols that rearrange themselves when observed. It carries the weight of centuries of accumulated magical knowledge.
description:
This elegant garment is made from exquisite cloth and adorned with silvery runes.

**Armor Class**
You gain these benefits while wearing the robe:
• Your base AC is 15 + your Dexterity modifier if you aren't wearing armor
• You have advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects
• Your spell save DC and spell attack bonus each increase by 2

name: Dancing Sword
flavour: Release the blade and it continues fighting on its own, spinning and slashing through the air with a warrior's grace. Some say a master swordsman's spirit is bound within.
description:
You can use a bonus action to toss this magic sword into the air and speak the command word. When you do so, the sword begins to hover, flies up to 30 feet, and attacks one creature of your choice within 5 feet of it.

**Dancing**
The sword uses your attack roll and ability score modifier to damage rolls. While the sword hovers, you can use a bonus action to cause it to fly up to 30 feet to another spot within 30 feet of you. On your turn, the sword attacks once. After the hovering sword attacks for the fourth time, it flies up to 30 feet and tries to return to your hand.

name: Belt of Fire Giant Strength
flavour: Forged in volcanic fire and quenched in giant's blood, this belt radiates intense heat. Those who wear it feel the unstoppable strength of the fire giants coursing through their limbs.
description: While wearing this belt, your Strength score changes to 25. If your Strength is already equal to or greater than 25, the belt has no effect on you.

name: Cloak of Arachnida
flavour: Spun from the silk of phase spiders, this cloak grants its wearer the predatory gifts of arachnids. Walls become floors, and webs become pathways.
description:
This fine garment is made of black silk interwoven with faint silvery threads. While wearing it, you gain the following benefits:

**Spider Climb**
You have a climbing speed equal to your walking speed, and can climb difficult surfaces including ceilings.

**Web Walker**
You can move through webs as if they were difficult terrain.

**Web Immunity**
You can't be caught in webs of any sort and have resistance to poison damage.

**Web Sense**
You have advantage on saving throws against being restrained by webs.

name: Armor of Invulnerability
flavour: This gleaming plate armor has never known a dent or scratch. Its metal holds an inner resilience that turns aside blows that would shatter lesser armor.
description:
You have resistance to nonmagical damage while you wear this armor.

**Invulnerability**
As an action, you can make yourself immune to nonmagical damage for 10 minutes or until you are no longer wearing the armor. Once this special action is used, it can't be used again until the next dawn.

name: Mantle of Spell Resistance
flavour: Woven with threads of nullifying silver, this mantle disrupts magical energies. Spells seem to slide off its surface like water off oil.
description: You have advantage on saving throws against spells while you wear this cloak.

name: Periapt of Wound Closure
flavour: This blood-red gemstone pulses with a warm glow when its wearer is injured. The magic within accelerates healing and staunches even the most grievous wounds.
description: While you wear this pendant, you stabilize whenever you are dying at the start of your turn. In addition, whenever you roll a Hit Die to regain hit points, double the number of hit points it restores.

name: Sword of Wounding
flavour: The blade's edge is impossibly thin, and wounds it inflicts refuse to close properly. Blood continues to flow long after the strike, as if the sword remembers each cut.
description:
Hit points lost to this weapon's damage can be regained only through a short or long rest, rather than by regeneration, magic, or any other means.

**Wounding**
Once per turn, when you hit a creature with an attack using this magic weapon, you can wound the target. At the start of each of the wounded creature's turns, it takes 1d4 necrotic damage for each time you've wounded it, and it can then make a DC 15 Constitution saving throw, ending the effect on a success.

name: Mace of Disruption
flavour: Holy symbols are etched into this mace's head, and it radiates a soft golden light. Undead and fiends instinctively fear it, for it carries the power to unmake them.
description:
When you hit a fiend or an undead with this magic weapon, that creature takes an extra 2d6 radiant damage. If the target has 25 hit points or fewer after taking this damage, it must succeed on a DC 15 Wisdom saving throw or be destroyed. On a successful save, the creature becomes frightened of you until the end of your next turn.

**Light**
While you hold this weapon, it sheds bright light in a 20-foot radius and dim light for an additional 20 feet.

name: Sword of Life Stealing
flavour: Dark runes pulse along the blade when it draws blood. Each kill feeds the sword, and in turn, it feeds its wielder—a hungry partnership of death.
description: When you attack a creature with this magic weapon and roll a 20 on the attack roll, that target takes an extra 3d6 necrotic damage, provided that the target isn't a construct or an undead. You gain temporary hit points equal to the extra damage dealt.

name: Rod of the Pact Keeper +2
flavour: This obsidian rod thrums with the power of otherworldly pacts. It strengthens the bond between warlock and patron, amplifying eldritch energies.
description:
While holding this rod, you gain a +2 bonus to spell attack rolls and to the saving throw DCs of your warlock spells.

**Pact Slot Recovery**
In addition, you can regain one warlock spell slot as an action while holding the rod. You can't use this property again until you finish a long rest.

name: Cape of the Mountebank
flavour: This cape smells faintly of brimstone—a reminder of its teleportation magic. Con artists and escape artists alike prize these capes for their dramatic exits.
description:
This cape smells faintly of brimstone. While wearing it, you can use it to cast the Dimension Door spell as an action. This property of the cape can't be used again until the next dawn.

**Dramatic Exit**
When you disappear, you leave behind a cloud of smoke, and you appear in a similar cloud of smoke at your destination. The smoke lightly obscures the space you left and the space you appear in, and it dissipates at the end of your next turn.

name: Boots of Speed
flavour: Lightning-bolt patterns trace along these boots, crackling with contained energy. When activated, the world seems to slow around you as you move with impossible swiftness.
description:
While you wear these boots, you can use a bonus action and click the boots' heels together. If you do, the boots double your walking speed, and any creature that makes an opportunity attack against you has disadvantage on the attack roll. If you click your heels together again, you end the effect.

**Duration**
When the boots' property has been used for a total of 10 minutes, the magic ceases to function until you finish a long rest.

name: Hat of Disguise
flavour: This unassuming hat holds powerful illusion magic. A perfect tool for spies, thieves, and anyone who needs to become someone else entirely.
description: While wearing this hat, you can use an action to cast the Disguise Self spell from it at will. The spell ends if the hat is removed.

name: Winged Boots
flavour: Delicate wings sprout from the heels of these boots, fluttering eagerly. They grant the freedom of the skies to those bound to the earth.
description:
While you wear these boots, you have a flying speed equal to your walking speed. You can use the boots to fly for up to 4 hours, all at once or in several shorter flights, each one using a minimum of 1 minute from the duration.

**Recharge**
If you are flying when the duration expires, you descend at a rate of 30 feet per round until you land. The boots regain 2 hours of flying capability for every 12 hours they aren't in use.

name: Eyes of the Eagle
flavour: These crystal lenses are carved to mimic the eyes of an eagle. When worn, distant objects snap into sharp focus, and hidden details become clear.
description: These crystal lenses fit over the eyes. While wearing them, you have advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight. In conditions of clear visibility, you can make out details of even extremely distant creatures and objects as small as 2 feet across.

name: Gloves of Thievery
flavour: These gloves are invisible while worn—perfect for activities best done unseen. They enhance dexterity and leave no fingerprints behind.
description: These gloves are invisible while worn. While wearing them, you gain a +5 bonus to Dexterity (Sleight of Hand) checks and Dexterity checks made to pick locks.

name: Scimitar of Speed
flavour: This curved blade seems to anticipate your movements, guiding your hand through strikes faster than thought. It hungers for battle and rewards speed.
description: You gain a +2 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic weapon. In addition, you can make one attack with it as a bonus action on each of your turns.

name: Necklace of Fireballs
flavour: Beads of condensed fire hang from this necklace, warm to the touch. Each bead contains an explosive spell waiting to be unleashed.
description:
This necklace has 1d6 + 3 beads hanging from it. You can use an action to detach a bead and throw it up to 60 feet away. When it reaches the end of its trajectory, the bead detonates as a 3rd-level Fireball spell (save DC 15).

**Multiple Beads**
You can throw multiple beads as one action. For each bead beyond the first, the level of the Fireball increases by 1.

name: Plate Armor +1
flavour: This masterwork plate armor gleams with magical reinforcement. Every joint and plate has been enchanted for superior protection.
description:
You have a +1 bonus to AC while wearing this armor.

Plate consists of shaped, interlocking metal plates to cover the entire body. A suit of plate includes gauntlets, heavy leather boots, a visored helmet, and thick layers of padding underneath the armor. Buckles and straps distribute the weight over the body.

name: Half Plate +1
flavour: Enchanted half plate that offers excellent protection while maintaining mobility. Popular among rangers and knights who value both.
description:
You have a +1 bonus to AC while wearing this armor.

Half plate consists of shaped metal plates that cover most of the wearer's body. It includes a helmet and greaves. It doesn't include leg protection beyond simple greaves attached with leather straps.

name: Dimensional Shackles
flavour: These adamantine shackles prevent not just physical escape but magical as well. Creatures bound within cannot teleport, plane shift, or otherwise flee through magical means.
description:
You can use an action to place these shackles on an incapacitated creature. The shackles adjust to fit a creature of Small to Large size.

**Dimensional Lock**
In addition to serving as mundane manacles, the shackles prevent a creature bound by them from using any method of extradimensional movement. The creature can't teleport or travel to a different plane of existence.

**Escape**
Escaping requires DC 30 Strength or DC 30 Dexterity check. A creature can make such a check every 30 days.

name: Immovable Rod
description:
This flat iron rod has a button on one end. You can use an action to press the button, which causes the rod to become magically fixed in place. Until you or another creature uses an action to push the button again, the rod doesn't move, even if it is defying gravity.

**Capacity**
The rod can hold up to 8,000 pounds of weight. More weight causes the rod to deactivate and fall.

name: Sending Stones
description:
Sending stones come in pairs, with each smooth stone carved to match the other so the pairing is easily recognized.

**Sending**
While you touch one stone, you can use an action to cast the Sending spell from it. The target is the bearer of the other stone. If no creature bears the other stone, you know that fact as soon as you use the stone and don't cast the spell.

Once Sending is cast through the stones, they can't be used again until the next dawn.

name: Eyes of Minute Seeing
description: These crystal lenses fit over the eyes. While wearing them, you can see much better than normal out to a range of 1 foot. You have advantage on Intelligence (Investigation) checks that rely on sight while searching an area or studying an object within that range.

name: Dust of Disappearance
description:
Found in a small packet, this powder resembles very fine sand. There is enough of it for one use.

**Invisibility**
When you use an action to throw the dust into the air, you and each creature and object within 10 feet of you become invisible for 2d4 minutes. The duration is the same for all subjects, and the dust is consumed when its magic takes effect. If a creature affected by the dust attacks or casts a spell, the invisibility ends for that creature.

name: Gloves of Missile Snaring
description:
These gloves seem to almost anticipate incoming projectiles. When a ranged weapon attack hits you while you're wearing them, you can use your reaction to reduce the damage by 1d10 + your Dexterity modifier, provided that you have a free hand.

**Catch**
If you reduce the damage to 0, you can catch the missile if it is small enough for you to hold in that hand.

name: Ring of Jumping
description: While wearing this ring, you can cast the Jump spell from it as a bonus action at will, but can target only yourself when you do so.

name: Ring of Swimming
description: You have a swimming speed of 40 feet while wearing this ring.

name: Ring of Warmth
description: While wearing this ring, you have resistance to cold damage. In addition, you and everything you wear and carry are unharmed by temperatures as low as -50 degrees Fahrenheit.

name: Pearl of Power
description: While this pearl is on your person, you can use an action to speak its command word and regain one expended spell slot. If the expended slot was of 4th level or higher, the new slot is 3rd level. Once you use the pearl, it can't be used again until the next dawn.

name: Driftglobe
description:
This small sphere of thick glass weighs 1 pound. If you are within 60 feet of it, you can speak its command word and cause it to emanate Light or Daylight. Once used, the Daylight effect can't be used again until the next dawn.

**Hovering**
You can speak another command word as an action to make the illuminated globe rise into the air and float no more than 5 feet off the ground. The globe hovers in this way until you or another creature grasps it.

name: Cloak of the Manta Ray
description: While wearing this cloak with its hood up, you can breathe underwater, and you have a swimming speed of 60 feet. Pulling the hood up or down requires an action.

name: Slippers of Spider Climbing
description:
While you wear these light shoes, you can move up, down, and across vertical surfaces and upside down along ceilings, while leaving your hands free. You have a climbing speed equal to your walking speed.

**Limitation**
The slippers don't allow you to move this way on a slippery surface, such as one covered by ice or oil.

name: Circlet of Blasting
description:
While wearing this circlet, you can use an action to cast the Scorching Ray spell with it. When you make the spell's attacks, you do so with an attack bonus of +5.

**Recharge**
The circlet can't be used this way again until the next dawn.

name: Medallion of Thoughts
description:
The medallion has 3 charges. While wearing it, you can use an action and expend 1 charge to cast the Detect Thoughts spell (save DC 13) from it.

**Recharge**
The medallion regains 1d3 expended charges daily at dawn.

name: Ring of Mind Shielding
description:
While wearing this ring, you are immune to magic that allows other creatures to read your thoughts, determine whether you are lying, know your alignment, or know your creature type. Creatures can telepathically communicate with you only if you allow it.

**Soul Storage**
If you die while wearing the ring, your soul enters it, unless it already houses a soul. You can remain in the ring or depart for the afterlife.

name: Stone of Good Luck (Luckstone)
description: While this polished agate is on your person, you gain a +1 bonus to ability checks and saving throws.

name: Weapon of Warning (Shortsword)
description: This magic weapon warns you of danger. While the weapon is on your person, you have advantage on initiative rolls. In addition, you and any of your companions within 30 feet of you can't be surprised, except when incapacitated by something other than nonmagical sleep. The weapon magically awakens you and your companions within range if any of you are sleeping naturally when combat begins.

name: Javelin of Lightning
description:
This javelin is a magic weapon. When you hurl it and speak its command word, it transforms into a bolt of lightning, forming a line 5 feet wide that extends out from you to a target within 120 feet.

**Lightning Bolt**
Each creature in the line excluding you and the target must make a DC 13 Dexterity saving throw, taking 4d6 lightning damage on a failed save, and half as much damage on a successful one. The lightning bolt turns back into a javelin when it reaches the target.

This property can't be used again until the next dawn.

name: Trident of Fish Command
description:
This trident is a magic weapon. It has 3 charges. While you carry it, you can use an action and expend 1 charge to cast Dominate Beast (save DC 15) from it on a beast that has an innate swimming speed.

**Recharge**
The trident regains 1d3 expended charges daily at dawn.

name: Wand of Web
description:
This wand has 7 charges. While holding it, you can use an action to expend 1 of its charges to cast the Web spell (save DC 15) from it.

**Recharge**
The wand regains 1d6 + 1 expended charges daily at dawn. If you expend the wand's last charge, roll a d20. On a 1, the wand crumbles into ashes and is destroyed.

name: Wand of Enemy Detection
description:
This wand has 7 charges. While holding it, you can use an action and expend 1 charge to speak its command word. For the next minute, you know the direction of the nearest creature hostile to you within 60 feet, but not its distance from you.

**Recharge**
The wand regains 1d6 + 1 expended charges daily at dawn. If you expend the wand's last charge, roll a d20. On a 1, the wand crumbles into ashes and is destroyed.

name: Sentinel Shield
description: While holding this shield, you have advantage on initiative rolls and Wisdom (Perception) checks. The shield is emblazoned with a symbol of an eye.

name: Mithral Chain Shirt
description:
Mithral is a light, flexible metal. A mithral chain shirt can be worn under normal clothes.

**No Strength Requirement**
If the armor normally has a Strength requirement, the mithral version of it doesn't.

**No Stealth Penalty**
If the armor normally imposes disadvantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks, the mithral version of it doesn't.

name: Adamantine Chain Mail
description:
This suit of armor is reinforced with adamantine, one of the hardest substances in existence.

**Critical Hit Immunity**
While you're wearing it, any critical hit against you becomes a normal hit.

name: Crossbow Bolts +1 (Bundle of 20)
description:
You have a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with these magic bolts. Once a bolt hits or misses its target, the magic fades and it becomes a mundane bolt.

**Bundle**
This bundle contains 20 bolts.

name: Horn of Silent Alarm
description: This horn has 4 charges. When you use an action to blow it, one creature of your choice can hear the horn's blare, provided the creature is within 600 feet of the horn and not deafened. No other creature hears sound coming from the horn. The horn regains 1d4 expended charges daily at dawn.

name: Candle of the Deep
description: The flame of this candle is not extinguished when immersed in water. It gives off light and heat like a normal candle.

name: Charlatan's Dice
description: Whenever you roll these dice, you can control which faces come up. This allows you to cheat at any dice game.

name: Hat of Vermin
description: This hat has 3 charges. While holding the hat, you can use an action to expend 1 of its charges and speak a command word that summons your choice of a bat, a frog, or a rat. The summoned creature appears in the hat and tries to get away from you as quickly as possible. It is neither combative nor friendly, and behaves like an ordinary creature of its kind. The hat regains all expended charges daily at dawn.

name: Mystery Key
description: A question mark is worked into the head of this key. The key has a 5 percent chance of unlocking any lock into which it's inserted. Once it unlocks something, the magic is gone.

name: Pipe of Smoke Monsters
description: While smoking this pipe, you can use an action to exhale a puff of smoke that takes the form of a single creature, such as a dragon, a flumph, or a froghemoth. The form must be small enough to fit in a 1-foot cube and loses its shape after a few seconds, becoming an ordinary puff of smoke.

name: Staff of Birdcalls
description:
This wooden staff is decorated with bird carvings. It has 10 charges. While holding it, you can use an action to expend 1 charge from the staff and cause it to create one of the following sounds: a finch's chirp, a raven's caw, a duck's quack, a chicken's cluck, a goose's honk, a loon's call, a turkey's gobble, a seagull's cry, an owl's hoot, or an eagle's shriek.

The staff regains 1d6 + 4 expended charges daily at dawn. If you expend the last charge, roll a d20. On a 1, the staff explodes in a harmless cloud of bird feathers and is lost forever.

name: Veteran's Cane
description: When you grasp this walking cane and use a bonus action to speak the command word, it transforms into an ordinary longsword and ceases to be magical.
